/20220823171728-quicknotes.title: 20220823171728-quicknotes
/20220823171728-quicknotes.content:
OR: [ive read somewhere and might want to read again](ive%20read%20somewhere%20and%20might%20want%20to%20read%20again.md)

 > 
 > ‚ÄúBecause when you give too many fucks‚Äîwhen you give a fuck about everyone and everything‚Äîyou will feel that you‚Äôre perpetually entitled to be comfortable and happy at all times, that everything is supposed to be just exactly the fucking way you want it to be. This is a sickness. And it will eat you alive. You will see every adversity as an injustice, every challenge as a failure, every inconvenience as a personal slight, every disagreement as a betrayal. You will be confined to your own petty, skull-sized hell, burning with entitlement and bluster, running circles around your very own personal Feedback Loop from Hell, in constant motion yet arriving nowhere.‚Äù
 > 
 > -Mark Manson, [The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fuck](../private/The%20Subtle%20Art%20of%20Not%20Giving%20a%20Fuck.md)

You know. This day won‚Äôt matter in few years. You know.

Yet, you stare at your phone and think - does anything ever mattered, really?

/20220827191808-quicknotes.title: 20220827191808-quicknotes
/20220827191808-quicknotes.content:
## Loop to get membership

[PowerShell](PowerShell.md)

````powershell
Import-Module AzureAD
Connect-AzureAD

$EnabledAccounts = Get-AzureADUser -All $true -Filter "accountenabled eq true and usertype eq 'member'" | Sort DisplayName

$EnabledAccounts | ForEach-Object { $properties = @{
    Name = $_.DisplayName
    Department = $_.Department
    Groups = (ForEach-Object{Get-AzureADUserMembership -All $true -ObjectID $_.ObjectID | Select-object -ExpandProperty DisplayName}) -join ";" }
    New-Object -TypeName psobject -Property $properties } | Select-Object Name,Department,Groups | Export-CSV -NoTypeInformation -Path c:\temp\Group-Memberships.csv


````

/A-Poem-for-Humanities.title: A Poem for Humanities
/A-Poem-for-Humanities.content:
also: [some old poetry i wrote when I was young](some%20old%20poetry%20i%20wrote%20when%20I%20was%20young.md)

(literally a school requirement)

$~$

Back then four years ago, when I had a project

Parts of a newspaper I had to present

So I went out and found tons of that paper

To produce a compilation that I am the creator

$~$

While scanning through pages, I caught sight of a section

Loaded with pictures that had my attention

So after I finished the project I needed to pass

I made an album from the photos I had seen once

$~$

Later this week, for the subject Humanities

We're given an activity before we're dismissed

To show pictures of what they call 'work of art'

To be submitted the next meeting before we start

$~$

I stumbled through my books to look for something

But then it happened that I still have that 'thing'

Kept in a box, dusted and colored like a lime

I smiled as I scrolled to the pages going back in time

$~$

I decided to cut the photos once again

Smiling on the thought that it was four years hidden

But then, when I saw that it won‚Äôt be enough

I decided to search once again from that 'magic box'

$~$

I saw the art works of a person once special

Which I always kept as a sign of remembrance

I decided to pick one and add to the compilation

And I wrote this poem to give the explanation

$~$

And now I present to those who can see

The pictures that time had hidden to me

Showing, explaining the work of human arts

Summarized in five pages, divided into parts

/All-your-perfects.title: All your perfects
/All-your-perfects.content:
---

OR: [ive read somewhere and might want to read again](ive%20read%20somewhere%20and%20might%20want%20to%20read%20again.md)

$~$

 > 
 > ‚ÄúI promise to love you more when you‚Äôre hurting than when you‚Äôre happy.
 > 
 > I promise to love you more when we‚Äôre poor than when we‚Äôre swimming in riches.
 > 
 > I promise to love you more when you‚Äôre crying than when you‚Äôre laughing.
 > 
 > I promise to love you more when you‚Äôre sick than when you‚Äôre healthy.
 > 
 > I promise to love you more when you hate me than when you love me.
 > 
 > I promise to love you more as a childless woman than I would love you as a mother.
 > 
 > And I promise¬†.¬†.¬†. I swear¬†.¬†.¬†. that if you choose to end things between us, I will love you more as you‚Äôre walking out the door than on the day you walked down the aisle.
 > 
 > I hope you choose the road that will make you the happiest. Even if it‚Äôs not a choice I‚Äôll love, I will still always love you. Whether I‚Äôm a part of your life or not. You deserve happiness more than anyone I know.
 > 
 > I love you. Forever.‚Äù

/Because-itll-never-feel-this-way-again.title: Because it‚Äôll never feel this way again
/Because-itll-never-feel-this-way-again.content:
---

OR: [ive read somewhere and might want to read again](ive%20read%20somewhere%20and%20might%20want%20to%20read%20again.md)

$~$

Go outside, take a breath

Spin around, and let out a laugh

Because it‚Äôs never going to feel this way again

$~$

Hum on the subway, text them first 

Smile at strangers, it could be worse

And it‚Äôs never going to feel this way again

$~$

Drink it in and hold me tighter 

Because this world keeps getting wider 

And it‚Äôs never going to feel this way again

$~$

I don‚Äôt want to sit back and let life fly away

I want to touch it, breathe it, carve it in my bones

I want to fall hard, crash and burn

Under city skylines and stars and birds

Because it‚Äôs never going to feel this way again

$~$

Buy that new book you‚Äôve been adoring 

Take that dare you‚Äôve been ignoring

Because it‚Äôs never going to feel this way again

$~$

Take a train, call a cab

Lean out the window and grab his hand

Because it‚Äôs never going to feel this way again

$~$

I don‚Äôt want to be restrained to a vanilla life

I want to taste it, hold it, savor every drop

I want to jump off cliffs and freeze and fly

Fill up every second until I die

Because it‚Äôs never going to feel this way again

$~$

Let your heart be young

Let moments sing, and always be listening

Because they‚Äôre never going to sound like that again

$~$

Lean in, kiss quick, then slip away

Seep in, ride your bike far away

Go on adventures, leap and run

Don‚Äôt be afraid to love someone

Because it‚Äôll never feel this way again

/Cupcake-and-peas.title: Cupcake and peas
/Cupcake-and-peas.content:
also: [some old poetry i wrote when I was young](some%20old%20poetry%20i%20wrote%20when%20I%20was%20young.md)

(i wrote this for an elementary paper pretending I was a first grade kid lol)

$~$

I shared a cupcake with my seat mate

And she shared her bag of peas

At the shade of the tree, we sat

When someone, on our shoulders, pat.

$~$

"Give me your food!" The kid yelled

He took the cupcake from my friend

So i yelled "Teacher! Teacher! A bully!"

And came my teacher running in a hurry

$~$

Now he's talking to the principal

Probably teaching him some moral

So we sat back at the shade in peace

As we eat our cupcakes and peas

/Dearest.title: Dearest
/Dearest.content:
Dearest,

Do you, my beloved, have a slight inkling of how you remoulded this existence of mine many would call a life?

For years I‚Äôm a walking catastrophe, reeling storms and destruction in paths I walked through. For years I‚Äôm a suppressed soul, a beast no one can tame.

But then you came, your entirety of amazingness, engrossing the deepest abyss of my thoughts. Yet, a writer I am with words as my sword, my trustworthy weapon fails me, for no phrase that comes in mind could possibly do justice ‚Äì none ‚Äì of what I feel for you.

Your eyes glisten of innocence; undisclosed to the wrath of the world. There‚Äôs magic on your luscious lips I dare not to explain, yet should try: *enchanted*. 

For how words that emanates out of it makes me hold my breath ‚Äì and do the same when it touches mine. I‚Äôd willingly clutch it longer yearning it‚Äôll linger for a lifetime.

Your touch spreads a sensation in me ‚Äì of what‚Äôs like a forest fire, burning me up from the inside. I am mesmerized, in awe, and indebted, for Cupid decided to string our fates together. 

Love, this letter is a failure, an absolute absurdity, for it can never illustrate the adoration buried in my heart for you. 

This shall I do, to the crack of doom, I shall follow you.

Forever.

A

/Homophobia.title: Homophobia
/Homophobia.content:
---

OR: [ive read somewhere and might want to read again](ive%20read%20somewhere%20and%20might%20want%20to%20read%20again.md)

$~$

A: Will, can you teach me about homophobia?

W: Sure, you know I don't like carrots?

A: Yeah.

W: Well because I don't personally like them, I don't want you to eat them either.

A: That's ridiculous.

W: That's homophobia.

/I-cant-think-straight.title: I can't think straight
/I-cant-think-straight.content:
OR: [ive read somewhere and might want to read again](ive%20read%20somewhere%20and%20might%20want%20to%20read%20again.md)

 > 
 > Every night I empty my heart, but by morning it‚Äôs full again
 > 
 > Slow droplets of you seep in through the night‚Äôs soft caress
 > 
 > At dawn I overflow with thoughts of us
 > 
 > And aching pleasure that gives me no respite
 > 
 > Love cannot be contained
 > 
 > The neat packaging of desire splits asunder
 > 
 > Spilling crimson through my days
 > 
 > Long languishing days that are now bruised tender with yearning
 > 
 > Spent searching for a fingerprint, a scent, a breath you left behind.
 > 
 > -Shamim Sarif, I Can't Think Straight

/Less-Beautiful.title: Less Beautiful
/Less-Beautiful.content:
Or: [ive read somewhere and might want to read again](../private/01-slipbox/ive%20read%20somewhere%20and%20might%20want%20to%20read%20again.md)

‚ÄúCan I see my baby?‚Äù the happy new mother asked.

When the bundle was nestled in her arms and she moved the fold of cloth to look upon his tiny face, she gasped. The doctor turned quickly and looked out the tall hospital window. The baby had been born without ears.

Time proved that the baby‚Äôs hearing was perfect. It was only his appearance that was marred.

When he rushed home from school one day and flung himself into his mother‚Äôs arms, she sighed, knowing that his life was to be a succession of heartbreaks.

He blurted out the tragedy: ‚ÄúA boy, a big boy‚Ä¶ called me a freak.‚Äù

He grew up, handsome for his misfortune. A favorite with his fellow students, he might have been class president, but for that. He developed a gift, a talent for literature and music. ‚ÄúBut you might mingle with other young people,‚Äù his mother reproved him, but felt a kindness in her heart.

The boy‚Äôs father had a session with the family physician. Could nothing be done? ‚ÄúI believe I could graft on a pair of outer ears, if they could be procured,‚Äù the doctor decided.

Whereupon the search began for a person who would make such a sacrifice for a young man. Two years went by.

Then, ‚ÄúYou are going to the hospital, Son. Mother and I have someone who will donate the ears you need. But it‚Äôs a secret,‚Äù said the father.

The operation was a brilliant success, and a new person emerged. His talents blossomed into genius, and school and college became a series of triumphs. Later he married and entered the diplomatic service.

‚ÄúBut I must know!‚Äù He urged his father, ‚ÄúWho gave so much for me? I could never do enough for him.‚Äù

‚ÄúI do not believe you could,‚Äù said the father, ‚Äúbut the agreement was that you are not to know ‚Ä¶ not yet.‚Äù

The years kept their profound secret, but the day did come ‚Ä¶ one of the darkest days that a son must endure. He stood with his father over his mother‚Äôs casket. Slowly, tenderly, the father stretched forth a hand and raised the thick, reddish-brown hair to reveal that the mother ‚Äî had no outer ears.

‚ÄúMother said she was glad she never let her hair be cut,‚Äù he whispered gently, ‚Äúand nobody ever thought Mother less beautiful, did they?‚Äù

Real beauty lies not in the physical appearance, but in the heart. Real treasure lies not in what that can be seen, but what that cannot be seen. Real love lies not in what is done and known, but in what that is done but not known.

Source: unknown

Credits: whoever had written this 

(I had this saved in my high school notes)

/Merge-Excel-Files.title: Merge Excel Files
/Merge-Excel-Files.content:
Merge excel files using [PowerShell](PowerShell.md)

````powershell

$ExcelObject=New-Object -ComObject excel.application
$ExcelObject.visible=$true
$ExcelFiles=Get-ChildItem -Path C:\Users\janea\Downloads\AdminDroid

$Workbook=$ExcelObject.Workbooks.add()
$Worksheet=$Workbook.Sheets.Item("Sheet1")

foreach($ExcelFile in $ExcelFiles){
 
$Everyexcel=$ExcelObject.Workbooks.Open($ExcelFile.FullName)
$Everysheet=$Everyexcel.sheets.item(1)
$Everysheet.Copy($Worksheet)
$Everyexcel.Close()
 
}
$Workbook.SaveAs("C:\Users\janea\Downloads\AdminDroid\merge.xlsx")
$ExcelObject.Quit()

````

/Meteorite.title: Meteorite
/Meteorite.content:
also: [some old poetry i wrote when I was young](some%20old%20poetry%20i%20wrote%20when%20I%20was%20young.md)

$~$

Careless whispers surround the night

Stars twinkle under the foggy twilight 

A shooting star emerged, giving a sight

Kindling my heart like a candlelight

$~$

You were seen in sight, but unreachable like heaven

Two feet away, yet too distant to happen

Longing for your closeness is what I had wished 

Before the unpredicted meteor vanished

$~$

Surrounded by distractions that fill us afar

Crowded, yet emptiness is all that we are

Sleepy eyelids fluttering to dream

Yet somehow your eyes still shine agleam

$~$

As I bade goodbye, I pray you walk me home

Like when we used to, in this small town, roam

It used to be us, tonight you latch unto them

Our secret foregone, we have long condemned

/Notes-on-Train-Story.title: Notes on Train Story
/Notes-on-Train-Story.content:
Insentra's Train Story:  [Insentra Train Story - Insentra Australia (insentragroup.com)](https://www.insentragroup.com/au/insights/not-geek-speak/business/insentra-train-story/)

I cant recall the last time I was this giddy about something. Maybe it was when I was just a kid and excited for the Christmas morning. Maybe it was the night before my parents told me we‚Äôre gonna be visiting the zoo back when I was seven. Being this nervous about something means it‚Äôs something I really want.

The moment I read the Train Story, I was hooked. I‚Äôve read it another four to five times, I even made an offline copy of the website page for my phone. Working with outsourcing companies for as long as I can remember, I‚Äôve always felt like we‚Äôre factories of knowledge and services which the companies use for profit. It‚Äôs not a bad thing, as I‚Äôm learning along the way.

But upon stumbling through Insentra‚Äôs values, I couldn‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs still a company that‚Äôs actually pro-employee. If the people who work on the train aren‚Äôt happy, the passengers won‚Äôt come back. And I like how it is that simple. I like how they value what others have already forgotten - honesty, integrity, trust. My grandmother had always said to find a guy with those values and marry him. (Well Grandma, I found a company, does that count?)

Being accountable for your actions, and celebrating the right things done. When efficiency doesn‚Äôt mean you‚Äôre underutilized. And service excellence internally will deliver service excellence externally. It‚Äôs like saying how you treat your workers will reflect on how they will treat your customers. And it shows.

One Team, One Dream - helping each other out and learning from each other. There will be things you know that your team doesn‚Äôt, and vice versa. Working as one means learning as one.

I love how the Train Story was well written. You‚Äôd know that it wasn‚Äôt written for promotion and marketing, because you can sense the feelings of it even through the screen. You can sense the thoughtfulness and honesty of it. It‚Äôs exciting to scroll through my phone reading it and seeing that the scrollbar has more to load - more to know about Insentra.

I even sent the link to few of my close friends asking them to read all through it- as it‚Äôs worth it.

It didn‚Äôt just motivate me to learn more, it motivated me to be a better version of myself. Knowing that there‚Äôs a possibility of joining a company that‚Äôs going to help me grow in all different ways, I didn‚Äôt want to miss the chance.

I‚Äôve always been a technical kid growing up. When my mom bought her first phone, I was the first to learn it even though I‚Äôm just on second grade. I would always excel in computer subjects and eventually took Bachelor in Science of Information Technology. It excites me to learn how things work, how it makes life easier. It excites me to automate something and testing it and knowing it works. And when I found out that Insentra‚Äôs offering an opportunity to work and learn more about so many technologies, I wanted a ticket to board the train and go to places I‚Äôve never been.

If there‚Äôs a carriage in the train that could fit me in, then I‚Äôm all aboard.

/PSADT.title: PSADT
/PSADT.content:
* Source: [PSAppDeployToolkit](https://psappdeploytoolkit.com/)

* Download here: [Releases ¬∑ PSAppDeployToolkit/PSAppDeployToolkit ¬∑ GitHub](https://github.com/PSAppDeployToolkit/PSAppDeployToolkit/releases)

* Download [ServiceUI](ServiceUI.md) for prompts

* References: [Using PSADT to bring system prompts to the user context (call4cloud.nl)](https://call4cloud.nl/2021/01/the-amazing-psadt/)

* The extract will contain

* ![](_attachments/341ee52d9d4fc5b9101e07f727c74e51.png)

* Add the [ServiceUI](ServiceUI.md) to the ToolKit location

* Paste your installer files inside "Files" folder

* Update the Deploy-Application.ps1 file

* ![](_attachments/c685f6c89e20a4a134d4e3afc363f46e.png)

* Insert the Installation task script 

* Test the package on sandbox

* `.\[[ServiceUI]].exe -Process:explorer.exe Deploy-Application.exe`

* ![](_attachments/0e6aa4e9ee665ad6f5b5fc1c740113c6.png)

* Once working, package using [IntuneWinAppUtil](IntuneWinAppUtil.md)

/PowerShell.title: PowerShell
/PowerShell.content:
---

OR: [i said I'll study](i%20said%20I'll%20study.md)

## Fundamentals

* [Variables](Variables) - store values and use as arguments
* [Functions](Functions) - list of statements or reusable commands
* [Flow Control](Flow%20Control) - If, ElseIf, Else
* [Loops](Loops) - ForEach, Do-While, Do
* [Error handling](Error%20handling) - Try, Catch, Finally
* [Expressions](Expressions) - operators and operands, computation - [Expressions - PowerShell | Microsoft Docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/lang-spec/chapter-07?view=powershell-7.2)

## Scope

* [Global Scope](Global%20Scope) - continues to exist after session ends
* [Script Scope](Script%20Scope) - no longer exists after file is finished running.
* [Local scope](Local%20scope) - current scope, can be [Global Scope](Global%20Scope) or [Script Scope](Script%20Scope)

### Scope rules

* Scopes can nest
* Items are visible in the current and child scopes
* Items can be changed only in the created scope

## [Parameters](../private/Parameters.md)

Source: [Exercise - Parameters - Learn | Microsoft Docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/script-with-powershell/5-exercise-parameters)

* use to make scripts flexible
* allows options or inputs from users
* [cmdlets](cmdlets), [Functions](Functions), [scripts](scripts) can all accept parameters
* all are optional by default
* [switch](../private/switch.md)

### Declaration

`Param()`

````powershell
# Create-File.ps1

Param(
	$Path
)

New-Item $Path
Write-Host "File $Path was created"
````

### Usage

````powershell
./Create-File.ps1 -Path c:\temp

````

### Mandatory parameters

`¬† [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]`

#### Usage

````powershell
¬†Param(

¬† ¬† [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]

¬† ¬† [String] $AdminSiteURL,

¬† ¬† [String] $ReportOutput

¬†)
````

 > 
 > \[!NOTE\] Summary
 > Using parameters can be set as switches on the script
 > 
 > Param(
 > $**Path**
 > )
 > 
 > ./Create-File.ps1 -**Path**

### Improving [parameters](../private/Parameters.md)

* setup optional or required parameters
* setup what allowed values can be
* can it accept more than one type of value? (string, boolean, int)
* use default when needed, but is it reliable?
* improve user experience by adding help message

````powershell
param(
	[String] $Param1
	[String] $Param2
	[Boolean] $Param3
)
````

## Command-based Help

(Apparently the comments on beginning of scripts aren't just to make them pretty lol)

* [What is Comment Based Help and Why Your Scripts Need It (inedo.com)](https://blog.inedo.com/powershell/what-is-comment-based-help)
* [Examples of Comment-Based Help - PowerShell | Microsoft Docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/developer/help/examples-of-comment-based-help?view=powershell-7.2)
* [Personal Command-based help template](../private/Personal%20Command-based%20help%20template.md)
* ![](_attachments/89dadb2d1a5e6fcddf2f9eca26cfc81b.png)

## Flow Control

* how code runs in console or script

### Sanitize input

* Ensure parameters hold reasonable values

### Control Execution flow

* decide how to run code. Ensure you get reasonable and correct input data

### Iterate over data

* essentially looping (iteration is looping)
* Can use array, json dataset etc
  * [PowerShell For Loop, ForEach-Object Loop and Other Loops (business.com)](https://www.business.com/articles/powershell-for-loop/)
  * [PowerShell looping examples for the 4 key commands (techtarget.com)](https://www.techtarget.com/searchitoperations/answer/PowerShell-looping-examples-for-the-4-key-commands)

**for** loop

````powershell
for (<Initial iterator value>; <Condition>; <Code to repeat>)
{
    <Statement list>
}
````

````powershell
for ($num = 1 ; $num -le 10 ; $num++){ 
"I count $num"
}
````

![](_attachments/24bdebeed005a02bd5760edc897e8d73.png)

**while** loop

* sometimes called pre-test loop
* instructions in the loop body will not be executed if the condition doesn't match
* condition only contains boolean
* to use a loop counter, you need to initialize it first
* LOGIC: unless condition is true, it will keep running the loop

/SC200.title: SC-200 Microsoft Security Operations Analyst
/SC200.content:
Related: [i said I'll study](i%20said%20I'll%20study.md)
Udemy course: [SC-200: Microsoft Security Operations Analyst (udemy.com)](https://blueapache.udemy.com/course/sc-200-microsoft-security-operations-analyst-exam-prep/learn/lecture/29680320#content)

Great Resources: [What's Microsoft Defender for identity? - GitBit](https://www.gitbit.org/course/ms-500/learn/Whats-Microsoft-Defender-for-identity-Kye_yNLxA)

## Security Operations Model

[Understand Microsoft 365 Defender in a Security Operations Center (SOC) - Training | Microsoft Learn](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-gb/training/modules/introduction-microsoft-365-threat-protection/3-understand-defender-security-operations-center)

1. Automation - auto-fix issues, well-defined attacks the org has seen many times
1. Triage - well-known incidents that still require quick human judgement
1. Investigation- more sophisticated attacks, deeper investigation
1. Hunt - proactively hunts for undetected threats
1. Threat Intelligence - reactive and proactive research, strategic analysis etc

## Defender Portal

[Use the Microsoft 365 Defender portal - Training | Microsoft Learn](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-gb/training/modules/mitigate-incidents-microsoft-365-defender/2-use-microsoft-security-center-portal)

 > 
 > **Microsoft Defender for Business**
 > 
 > There's a separate licensing model for MS Defender for Business specific for SMB (up to 300 employees)

* Microsoft Defender for Office 365 - email related, Office 365 resources related
* Microsoft Defender for Endpoint - devices
* Microsoft 365 Defender - part of the [Extended Detection and Response (XDR)](../private/01-slipbox/Extended%20Detection%20and%20Response%20(XDR).md) solution by Microsoft (parent of all defender products)
* Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps - cross-SaaS and PaaS, for cloud apps
* Microsoft Defender for Identity - AD, Azure AD security solution
* Microsoft Defender Vulnerability Management

# Microsoft Defender for Endpoint

## Onboarding a device

* single to 10 devices (onboarding script)
* group policy
* mecm
* intune
* vdi script for non-persistent machines

### MITRE Attack

* [MITRE ATT&CK¬Æ](https://attack.mitre.org/)

* Cyber Kill Chain - [Cyber Kill Chain¬Æ | Lockheed Martin](https://www.lockheedmartin.com/en-us/capabilities/cyber/cyber-kill-chain.html)
  ![](_attachments/4405d31e5a5e7e2df2a17507124cae4c.png)

* Techniques - https://attack.mitre.org/techniques

* MITRE - government funded

* ATTACK - Adversarial Tactics, Techniques and Common Knowledge

Defender is aligned with MITRE framework

* [x] create simulated attacks in lab

## Hunting

### Advanced hunting

* up to 30 days data
* query based threat hunting tool

#### Types:

* event or activity data - almost immediately updated with event data
* entity data - from static and dynamic data source (every 15 mins) 
  * consolidated every 24 hours

### Advanced Hunting Schema

* made of tables
* [view reference](_attachments/c052de26c44e1bd4d06e14d1afc2f64e.png) to see description and columns, as well as sample queries (or use schema reference button to search for the tables if there are too many tables)
* you can [click on the sample queries](_attachments/419eb30de4cf0877d49a79dcdc1b240a.gif) to create [kusto queries](kusto%20queries.md) automatically

## Email filtering services / Microsoft Defender for O365

Microsoft Defender for O365

* email filtering service
* phishing, malware, spams

From Defender portal > Email and Collaboration

* Threat Investigations
* Explorer (can see top targeted users)
* Review (quarantined emails)
* Attack simulation training (launch simulated attacks)

### Create Threat Policies

[Defender for Office 365 - Config](Defender%20for%20Office%20365%20-%20Config.md)

### Reports

From Defender portal > Reports > Email and collaboration Reports

### Attack simulation

* Did this for a client in the past. Report [here.](file:///C:/Users/janea/OneDrive/03%20-%20Professional/Corporate/Insentra/RPT-106353%20Atturra%20-%20Q1%20Phishing%20Simulation%20v001%20RELEASE.pdf)
* References: [Get started using Attack simulation training - Office 365 | Microsoft Learn](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/office-365-security/attack-simulation-training-get-started?view=o365-worldwide)
* Can create custom payloads too: [Payload automations for Attack simulation training - Office 365 | Microsoft Learn](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/office-365-security/attack-simulation-training-payload-automations?view=o365-worldwide)

# Microsoft Defender for Identity

* can capture on-premises AD signals

* reduction of [attack surface](../private/attack%20surface.md)

* [x] create defender for identity instance ‚úÖ 2022-10-28

UP NEXT: 

* [x] ‚è´ fix internet connection of lab ‚úÖ 2022-10-28
* [x] ‚è´ migrate the server roles - remaining 15 days before server expires ‚úÖ 2022-10-28
* [x] download sensor ‚úÖ 2022-10-28

Setting up PGJILAB | [General How Tos](onenote:https://d.docs.live.net/b7d16696854446dc/Documents/Notebooks/Upskilling/JILAB/General%20How%20Tos.one#section-id={3445A6EF-9B2B-42B6-BC09-9E056EF03F95}&end)¬† ([Web view](https://onedrive.live.com/view.aspx?resid=B7D16696854446DC%213573&id=documents&wd=target%28JILAB%2FGeneral%20How%20Tos.one%7C3445A6EF-9B2B-42B6-BC09-9E056EF03F95%2F%29))

## Installing Sensor

* NPCAP is needed. already part of installer
* Need latest windows update install
* ensure prerequisites are met
* install on Domain Controller

### Simulation

* Account used: JSJohns
* Signed in to Windows 11 domain joined machine
* downloaded mimikatz

UP NEXT:

* [x] https://2vb732sensorapi.atp.azure.com/ ensure is reachable ‚úÖ 2022-10-31

### Troubleshooting

![](_attachments/f185fa74e6513e210713294983095ca4.png)

Resource: [How to implement Defender for Identity and configure all prerequisites (jeffreyappel.nl)](https://jeffreyappel.nl/how-to-implement-defender-for-identity-and-configure-all-prerequisites/)

Note: Need to wait 10 hours before creating the gMSA account

Create: 

````powershell

New-ADServiceAccount‚ÄØ-Name‚ÄØMDIGMSA‚ÄØ-DNSHostName MDIGMSA.m365securitylab.local ‚ÄìDescription "Microsoft Defender for Identity service account" ‚ÄìKerberosEncryptionType‚ÄØAES256 ‚ÄìManagedPasswordIntervalInDays‚ÄØ30

````

Get gMSA details:

````powershell

Get-ADServiceAccount MDIGMSA -Properties * | fl DNSHostName, SamAccountName, KerberosEncryptionType, ManagedPasswordIntervalInDays, PrincipalsAllowedToRetrieveManagedPassword

````

Set Principals

````powershell

Set-ADServiceAccount -Identity MDIGMSA -PrincipalsAllowedToDelegateToAccount 'Domain Controllers'

````

Get gMSA details again, then test the service account

Test AD Service account

````powershell

Test-ADServiceAccount -Identity 'MDIGMSA'

````

### Onboard the sensor

Add Directory Service account 
![](_attachments/22d7a7e0a95b07f19208ccdeca55911b.png)

![](_attachments/95b66ce0ab4e4a9a20cd973b5c00a600.png)

Add sensor

Install NPCAP, then Azure ATP Sensor Setup

![](_attachments/27cd880e11cca38f763c403549094e78.png)

Setup honeytoken account 
(not to be used, used to trap malicious attacker)

![](_attachments/778c483b6ce75e924c604bc14c80b7ae.png)

Tag from Defender for Identity portal

![](_attachments/b56baa33cf64957ec897d0d35c286173.png)

Add sensitive users 

![](_attachments/ef1dccfa30ffc416f3941e85b10113c9.png)

### Enable data integration into MS Defender for Endpoint

![](_attachments/c9ce654b4d829fbe88e1326e05842b8a.png)

### Simulated attacks

* exclude Downloads folder from Windows Security > Virus and threat protection > Virus & threat protection settings > Exclusions
* installed [mimikatz](https://github.com/ParrotSec/mimikatz) and run .exe for simulated alerts
* From Security portal > Endpoints > Evaluation and tutorials > Tutorials & Simulation > Get Simulation files

Incidents:
![](_attachments/Pasted%20image%2020221108061709.png)

Alerts:
![](_attachments/Pasted%20image%2020221108061738.png)

## User Risks and Sign-in Risks

* User Risk - user's identity or account is compromised, unusual user behaviour or leaked credentials
* Sign-in risks - unfamiliar sign in, atypical travels, anonymous IPs

### Identity Protection

* User risk policy
  * can allow access and require password change
* Sign in risk policy
  * doesn't work for password change, only require MFA
* multi-factor authentication registration policy (require azure ad mfa authentication registration)

### License requirement

* AAD P2
* AAD P1 only has limited security reports, only users with medium and high risk are shown, no details for risky sign-ins report, and no details at all for risk detection report. 
* No notifications as well
* User, sign in, and MFA registration policies

### Simulate risky users and sign ins

* login to office account using TOR browser
  ![](_attachments/Pasted%20image%2020221108063727.png)
* then login to normal browser 
  ![](_attachments/Pasted%20image%2020221108063747.png)

# Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps

Originally: Microsoft Cloud App Security

CASB (Cloud Access Security Brokers)

* intermediary between users and cloud apps (somehow like a firewall)

## [Framework](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-cloud-apps/what-is-defender-for-cloud-apps#the-defender-for-cloud-apps-framework)

1. Discover and Control the use of [Shadow IT](https://www.forcepoint.com/cyber-edu/shadow-it)
1. Protect sensitive information (provides DLP protection)
1. Protect against cyberthreats
1. Assess compliance

## Conditional Access App Controls

* allows BYOD whilst protecting corporate data
* integrates well with different cloud apps identity provider
* monitor and control user access to applications
* enforce access and session controls
  * prevent data exfiltration
  * protect on download
  * prevent upload of unlabeled files
  * monitor user sessions
  * block access and custom activities

## Phases of Defender for Cloud Apps

1. Discover data
   * apps should be connected to MDCA using application connector or conditional access app control
   * From portal.cloudappsecurity.com > Investigate > Connected Apps
1. Classify Sensitive Information
   * apply labels
   * From portal.cloudappsecurity.com > Settings > Information Protection > Microsoft Information Protection
   * ![](_attachments/Pasted%20image%2020221109070840.png)
1. Protect data
   * create file policies
   * From portal.cloudappsecurity.com > Control > Policies
   * can create file policies from templates (ie alert when sharing to personal emails, or stale shared files externally)
1. Monitor and report
   * use MDCA dashboard > Alerts > Incidents

# Data Loss Prevention

* identify sensitive information shared across platforms (like credit card numbers etc)
* prevent accidental sharing of sensitive files

/ServiceUI.title: ServiceUI
/ServiceUI.content:
Related: [PowerShell](PowerShell.md) [IntuneWinAppUtil](IntuneWinAppUtil.md)

* Download the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit *MDT* to get the ServiceUI.exe file

* [Download Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) from Official Microsoft Download Center](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/confirmation.aspx?id=54259)

* It will install first, then you can grab the ServiceUI.exe from C:\Program Files\Microsoft Deployment Toolkit\Templates\Distribution\Tools\x86\

also: [some old poetry i wrote when I was young](some%20old%20poetry%20i%20wrote%20when%20I%20was%20young.md)

$~$

I tried to sleep, you‚Äôre keeping me awake

With all your words, to me are fake

I don‚Äôt even know which ones are real

Even if it's not, let‚Äôs make a deal

$~$

I‚Äôll fall in love but you‚Äôll catch me 

I‚Äôll laugh with you, but you‚Äôll love me 

It wasn‚Äôt the first time I'd felt this way

But I hope you respond to what I‚Äôll say

$~$

You were in my dreams when I sleep at night

You‚Äôre on my mind when I‚Äôm awake at my might

In every song, I hear your voice

I hope I‚Äôm not one of your so-called toys

$~$

I know it‚Äôs not that deep but we‚Äôll get there

It'll take a while, but we'll get somewhere

As I write this note, I‚Äôm thinking of you

I hope you feel the same way I do

## Attempts

Can't seem to make this work: [Setup (jzhao.xyz)](https://quartz.jzhao.xyz/notes/setup/)
also: 

* need to keep private notes unpublished
* want to keep everything in one vault

Found this resource!:

* [Publish your Obsidian Vault Online for Free with Quartz - YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ITiiuBNVue0)
* [Publishing your Obsidian Vault Online with Quartz (brandonkboswell.com)](https://brandonkboswell.com/blog/Publishing-your-Obsidian-Vault-Online-with-Quartz/)

Steps I did:

* tried to install npm, go etc but hard to use with Windows 11. 
* Installed Linux on Windows instead using [WSL](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/install)
* Cloned [Quartz](https://github.com/jackyzha0/quartz), [obsidian-export](https://github.com/brandonkboswell/obsidian-export), [hugo-obsidian](https://github.com/jackyzha0/hugo-obsidian), and my empty [digital-garden](https://github.com/janeilagan/digital-garden) repo, locally.
* ![](_attachments/f112e8405311f228eab54d4f87a50fb9.png) 
* ![](_attachments/30e2229dcfca767e579587a0a7c458a2.png)
* Used `-f` as the posted command fails.

````git
git submodule add -f https://github.com/janeilagan/digital-garden.git ./public

````

* Installed Hugo ![](_attachments/06112138507661c07f32468184c13113.png)

* for this one ![](_attachments/684b2a59a0610de2dfdbf05476061237.png) >> i used `sudo apt-get install cargo` then: `curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://sh.rustup.rs | sh` >> then run `cargo build` again

* can't get 'go' to work properly
  ![](_attachments/9185b4412f47ebc60683a218e34c0d8f.png)

````zsh
export GOPATH=$HOME/go  
export GOROOT="$(brew --prefix golang)/libexec"  
export PATH="$PATH:${GOPATH}/bin:${GOROOT}/bin"
source $HOME/.zshrc
````

* For nodemon `sudo apt-get install npm`
* changed zsh to bash

````bash
sudo chsh -s /bin/zsh $USER
````

/The-First-Day-I-Thought.title: The First Day - I Thought
/The-First-Day-I-Thought.content:
also: [some old poetry i wrote when I was young](some%20old%20poetry%20i%20wrote%20when%20I%20was%20young.md)

$~$

Time moves agonizingly slow

No right words ought to follow 

Feeling like my body is trapped

Nowhere to go, in this hell, I'm stuck

$~$

Time moves a little bit faster 

But still every minute, I want to surrender

Time moves a little too fast

And yet I can't forget about our past

$~$

Hearts beat calm and slow

Distinct voices in our past, they echo

Like a show, I watched the credits fade away 

Moving, nothing to do, nothing to say

$~$

Day one, and yet it felt like forever

You wondered if this pain will never be over

And even when you knew you can move on

You still stare at his face through the phone

$~$

How long would you suffer, you ask? 

How long do you have to wear that mask?

You fell asleep, bringing all the pain 

To the abyss of memories, unending rain

/The-Last-Day-I-Stopped.title: The Last Day - I Stopped
/The-Last-Day-I-Stopped.content:
also: [some old poetry i wrote when I was young](some%20old%20poetry%20i%20wrote%20when%20I%20was%20young.md)

$~$

It's been too long since our goodbye

It's funny how it went, all reasons why

It's been a while since we chose to stay

Now we can't even talk and say 'hey'

$~$

From everything that happened, were you fine?

I found myself wondering if you were ever mine

"We're not friends, nor enemies,

Just two strangers with shared memories"

$~$

I often wonder if what we had was fake

I don't have a clue how long it will take

For both our souls to find their way

Hoping to be together, hoping it'll be okay

$~$

It's been too long since our first hello

Since we both basked through its afterglow

It's been a while since you chose to leave

Leaving both our hearts to grieve

/When-Summer-and-Autumn-Collided.title: When Summer and Autumn Collided
/When-Summer-and-Autumn-Collided.content:
also: [some old poetry i wrote when I was young](some%20old%20poetry%20i%20wrote%20when%20I%20was%20young.md) 

$~$

An eighteen-day gap on our twin-month birthday

You were born Friday, I was on the last Tuesday

Same month, same year, yet two different signs

And fate brought us to meet as the stars conspire

$~$

Alone in one room, with everything as the difference

I‚Äôm autumn equinox, you‚Äôre summer solstice

Your straight black hair, my curly brown undone

And next to my long fingers, crossed your small, little ones

$~$

I looked at your eyes, speaking into mine

Your lips quivering, like you were about to cry

We looked at each other, and then we realized

The difference is too different, we're no longer surprised

$~$

Does "I love you" still count after goodbye?

Can it bring it all back every time we cry?

We thought we'll forever have each other's side

But all along our signs were telling us we'll never collide

/how-do-I-ensure-my-devices-are-synced.title: how do I ensure my devices are synced
/how-do-I-ensure-my-devices-are-synced.content:
## What I'm looking for

* not costly (I really want to try Obsidian Sync but I'm not sure if it's worth it)
* can sync with iPhone and iPad
* can sync with other Windows devices
* sync plugins as well 
* make use of my OneDrive Personal storage/subscription
* encryption

### Options

#### [Syncthing](https://syncthing.net/)

* usage is only free up to 20MB

#### [Remotely-save](https://github.com/remotely-save/remotely-save)

* open source and free
* can be used with iPhone and iPad
  * caveat: will be using the phone/iPad's storage
  * plugins are not synced (not sure if this is possible since sync with _ is available, but since I'm using git too I didn't want to sync that as well)
* makes use of OneDrive Personal 
* encrypted, but I personally used another OneDrive account rather than granting the plugin access to my personal one.
* easy to configure.
* went with this!

/how-much-should-you-publish-online.title: how much should I publish online
/how-much-should-you-publish-online.content:
## [should I publish my notes online](../private/should%20I%20publish%20my%20notes%20online.md)?

Permanent notes are directed towards audience ignorant of the thoughts behind the text
unsure of what the context is only have general knowledge on the field;

(or as my anxiety tells me, can be read by someone who already knows that same shit and would judge you because you're writing shit.)

So, instead, I decided I will be writing for myself. Because [the only way to learn in public is to build in public](the%20only%20way%20to%20learn%20in%20public%20is%20to%20build%20in%20public.md).

Whilst reorganizing my old notes, I found so many poems and novels and ideas that never really went out. Or if it did, I hid behind anonymous pennames (just because.)

I don't have Facebook, Instagram, Twitter or any personal account so putting this out made me [anxious about digital footprint and privacy](../private/anxious%20about%20digital%20footprint%20and%20privacy.md). 

Fueled by self doubts, I was asking myself If I needed a penname, or if I should have all my notes (personal and professional) here, or if I really plan on staying anonymous for life.

I still don't know the answer to it.

Taking one step at a time :)

/how-to-publish-your-notes-online.title: How to publish your notes online
/how-to-publish-your-notes-online.content:
## What I want

* little to no cost (Obsidian Publish is great but costly üò•)
* with graph view
* easy to deploy
* using GitHub Pages

### [how much should you publish online](how%20much%20should%20you%20publish%20online.md)

* [The only way to learn in public is to build in public ‚Ä¢ Mental Nodes](https://www.mentalnodes.com/the-only-way-to-learn-in-public-is-to-build-in-public)
* For inspiration: [About ‚Ä¢ Mental Nodes](https://www.mentalnodes.com/about)
  * This is using this [kmcgillivray/obsidian-lettersmith: Transform any Obsidian vault (or any folder of markdown files) into a backlink-powered static website using Lettersmith. (github.com)](https://github.com/kmcgillivray/obsidian-lettersmith)

## Options

[Obsidian Publish alternatives - Share & showcase - Obsidian Forum](https://forum.obsidian.md/t/obsidian-publish-alternatives/22886)

### [obsidian-userland/publish](https://obsidian-userland.github.io/)

* looks simple and nice, but long way to go and too many limitations

### [Pubsidian](https://forum.obsidian.md/t/pubsidian-free-and-elegant-obsidian-publish-alternative/21825)

* needs to be installed (it's essentially a converter)
* great view, would consider using because of interface
* using Netlify (for some reason my ISP blocks Netlify here)
* Attempts:
  * not working yet (cant get it to show the actual pages!) 
  * Update: got it working but links are not working T_T
  * Pause. Trying something else.

### [Obsidian mkdocs](https://github.com/jobindjohn/obsidian-publish-mkdocs)

* should be easy to use and deploy as I have used mkdocs before 
* however no graph view

### [Perlite](https://github.com/secure-77/Perlite)

* too many dependencies
* too many tweaking required
* I need to read through further to know, long learning curve

### [Mindstone](https://github.com/TuanManhCao/digital-garden)

* UI looks great
* plain graph (in comparison to Pubsidian and obsidian-nola )
* can be tested locally
* known issues with graph view

### [Obsidian Zola](https://github.com/ppeetteerrs/obsidian-zola)

* really pretty interface based from Adidoks
* Using Netlify (still can't get it to work with my ISP)
* Cant get to work locally for testing
* was able to partially make it work, but links aren't working, and having hard time testing it because of ISP limitation (I had to use VPN)

### [Quartz](https://github.com/jackyzha0/quartz)

* pretty interface, sitting on top of Hugo
* can use GitHub pages
* can test locally
* has graph interface (and pretty one too!)
* [THIS IS IT I JUST NEED TO MAKE IT WORK!!](THIS%20IS%20IT%20I%20JUST%20NEED%20TO%20MAKE%20IT%20WORK!!.md)

/how-to-write-notes-properly.title: How to write notes properly
/how-to-write-notes-properly.content:
## Is there a correct way of writing notes?

Like everyone who wanted some sort of workflow in the way they take down notes, I became obsessed with PKMs and Obsidian.

Back in the older days, I would buy physical notebooks (even though I was never really a good note taker). I just loved the idea of having a place to write down anything and come back to it when I want to. 

I started tinkering with Notion, even halfway moving all my notes to it, but then I realized that I was spending my time customizing Notion, rather than actually taking notes and making use of them. 

And whilst I was knee-deep into researching about Notion templates and workflows, I stumbled upon the PKM world, and then Obsidian. 

At the time of this writing, I've only been using Obsidian for a couple of months. I had so many questions around PKMs and Obsidian in general, which spiraled into more questions about my personal workflow, and led me into an existential crisis. 

Questions like [best way to take notes](best%20way%20to%20take%20notes.md) became [should I publish my notes online](../private/should%20I%20publish%20my%20notes%20online.md) then [how much should you publish online](how%20much%20should%20you%20publish%20online.md), spiraling into *oh wait I'm [anxious about digital footprint and privacy](../private/anxious%20about%20digital%20footprint%20and%20privacy.md)* into *but what if I need to note down something on my phone, [how do I ensure my devices are synced](how%20do%20I%20ensure%20my%20devices%20are%20synced.md)* and then worrying about [how do I back up my notes](../private/how%20do%20I%20back%20up%20my%20notes.md) and so on.

My head was in overdrive because there's all these possibilities and just *where the hell do I start?*

/ive-read-somewhere-and-might-want-to-re.title: ive read somewhere and might want to read again

/my-digital-garden.title: my digital garden
/my-digital-garden.content:
## Hi, I'm Jane

I'm a tech enthusiast and a cat mom of four. Professionally, I work in IT, but I enjoy tech in general.

I tend to get lost in the rabbit hole of *attempting* to [build my second brain](../private/build%20my%20second%20brain.md) using [Obsidian](https://obsidian.md/) and [Notion](https://www.notion.so/). The intent of this site is to become [my digital garden](https://janeilagan.github.io/digital-garden/) and not a formal blog. It's less focused on polishing what I put here, so if you see any dead links, those are probably ideas not cultivated yet, or they link to my private notes inside my vault. 

The majority of the time, the notes are written as if I'm talking to myself.

(Because I am.)

The goal is to put these thoughts out there, look back at them years later, and cringe. Hard.

$~$

 > 
 > Learn to live alongside cringe. No matter how hard you try to avoid being cringe, you will look back on your life and cringe retrospectively. Cringe is unavoidable over a lifetime. Even the term ‚Äòcringe‚Äô might someday be deemed ‚Äòcringe‚Äô.
 > 
 > -Taylor Swift, NYU speech

$~$

### digital swiss army knife

[wox](https://github.com/Wox-launcher/) | [vscode](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode) | [share-x](https://github.com/ShareX) | [obsidian](https://obsidian.md/) | [notion](https://www.notion.so/) | [bitwarden](https://github.com/bitwarden) 

$~$

### credits

[stealing from my heroes](https://joschuasgarden.com/30+External/31+Books/Steal+Like+an+Artist+%E2%80%93+10+Things+Nobody+Told+You+About+Being+Creative) | this digital garden is made possible with [Obsidian](https://obsidian.md/), [Quartz](https://github.com/jackyzha0/quartz), this awesome [blog](https://brandonkboswell.com/blog/Publishing-your-Obsidian-Vault-Online-with-Quartz/), and [mental nodes](https://www.mentalnodes.com/) for inspiration.

$~$

### contact

I'm only available online here, on [GitHub](https://github.com/janeilagan) and [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/janeilagan/). 

(If you're looking to hire me, here's my [resume](https://janeilagan.github.io/resume/).)

/pick-a-seed.title: pick a seed

/rai.title: rai
/rai.content:
OR: [ive read somewhere and might want to read again](ive%20read%20somewhere%20and%20might%20want%20to%20read%20again.md)

 > 
 > I hate things touching my neck. It makes me so uncomfortable. Especially when people do it. But also, I act on not being comfortable or pressure. So when I lack confidence, I do things that make me uncomfortable. So when I need to do things I'm not comfortable with, I wear a turtle neck.
 > 
 > Oh and I have a distinct fear of bread.
 > 
 > Also, string cheese. God. I hate it so much.
 > 
 > Also, I have a fear of like, people touching my shoulder. Specifically for more than one minute. It's not okay.
 > 
 > So like if I let someone touch my shoulder, neck, or back, they should be honored because that means I trust them a lot.
 > 
 > Also, the letter Q freaks me out. It's like an O with a tail. It's incognito. Like, what's it got to hide?
 > 
 > I hate the word moist. It's not okay.
 > 
 > Also, I ramble when I'm nervous.
 > 
 > Recently, I learned that I blink a lot when I'm shocked.
 > 
 > When I blush, it lasts for a really long time. Like once, it lasted for two weeks. I was mortified.
 > 
 > I have a fear of clowns. And mimes. Oh God mimes.
 > 
 > And butterflies. They are literally flying paper. It's not natural.
 > 
 > And I say "spicy", "litty", "oof" and "oh boy" for like any situation.
 > 
 > I also sit in odd places. Like I sit in the dishwasher sometimes.
 > 
 > When I get flustered, I drink juice. If I don't have juice, I die.
 > 
 > Once when I was twelve, my brother dared me to smoke an index card and I did. I couged for half an hour.
 > 
 > I hate bananas but love the color yellow.
 > 
 > My favorite word is Hypnagogia because it's the state when you're half asleep but still half awake.
 > 
 > Also, my favorite flower is the white rose.
 > 
 > And green, black, yellow, blue, any shade of gray (yes all 50.) Red, Maroon, and neon yellow are my favorite colors.
 > 
 > Okay. I'm done now.
 > 
 > Oh no, I'm not. I may have a feeling for a close friend. That's why I'm rambling. I'm hella nervous.

 > 
 > -From Rai, an old friend, via personal message

/see-what-questions-to-ask.title: see what questions to ask
/see-what-questions-to-ask.content:
* what's missing?
* can i add something to it?
* combine something?
* [how does this fit to things i already know](../private/how%20does%20this%20fit%20to%20things%20i%20already%20know.md)
* [can i use other words or terms to explain this properly](../private/can%20i%20use%20other%20words%20or%20terms%20to%20explain%20this%20properly.md)
* [how can i use this to explain another idea](../private/how%20can%20i%20use%20this%20to%20explain%20another%20idea.md)
* [when would i need this note again](../private/when%20would%20i%20need%20this%20note%20again.md)
* will i publish this online? [how much should you publish online](how%20much%20should%20you%20publish%20online.md)

/the-only-way-to-learn-in-public-is-to-b.title: the only way to learn in public is to build in public
/the-only-way-to-learn-in-public-is-to-b.content:
> 
 > The only way to learn in public is to build in public
 > 
 > -Mental Nodes ([The only way to learn in public is to build in public ‚Ä¢ Mental Nodes](https://www.mentalnodes.com/the-only-way-to-learn-in-public-is-to-build-in-public))

This is to remind myself that I'm doing this for myself, for self-learning, and accept constructive feedback because those will push me into being a better version of myself. That it's okay to make mistakes, it's okay to change your mind, and it's okay to be embarrassed by what I originally put out, edit it again and make it better.
